turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: My REAL father was a famous German composer

turns.speaker: AUNT MORAG
turns.text: Ohh the tag is broken.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: .... They met when my mother was an opera singer... in Luxemburg...

turns.speaker: AUNT MORAG
turns.text: I thought she met your father in Luxemburg.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Well, yes, in Austria where be conducted the Royal Orchestra.

turns.speaker: AUNT MORAG
turns.text: And where did they get married?

turns.speaker: AUNT MORAG
turns.text: Which mountains are those dear?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: The Alps.

turns.speaker: AUNT MORAG
turns.text: Ohhh I've never been there.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Mother used to sing the songs in German and her voice would echo across the valleys

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: One day when my mother and father were singing together in the forest, a great storm blew up out of nowhere. But so passionate was their singing that they did not notice, nor did they stop as the rain began to fall and when their voices rose for the final bars of the duet a great bolt of lightening came out of the sky and struck my father so that he lit up like a torch... And at the same moment my father was struck dead my mother was struck dumb! She- never-spoke-another-word.

turns.speaker: AUNT MORAG
turns.text: Ohhh ... dear. Not another word From the shock, yes it would be.

turns.speaker: AUNT MORAG
turns.text: Well, that is a strong opinion.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Yes, it's unholy.

turns.speaker: HIRA
turns.text: I got the good wife for you Peini. She pray good. Clean. Read Bible. You sleep her Peini. She chief daughter.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: No, no bible readers.

turns.speaker: HIRA
turns.text: Don't answer, he low born. Jun look at him, mongrel. Your wife where she?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: She lives her own life in New Jersey, America.

turns.speaker: HIRA
turns.text: You have spare wife here Peini. You get rnana for that. Our chief four wives.

turns.speaker: HIRA
turns.text: Go Peini ... Haere atu e Peini.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I'll be back.

turns.speaker: HIRA
turns.text: I worry for you.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: No, I love her, we will be a family. I have her piano. I will mend it, she will get better.

turns.speaker: HIRA
turns.text: I miss you.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: She looks tired.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: She's stunted, that's one thing.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: What's he say?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Someone died here. It's tapu.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: But we came down this way didn't we? I'm sure we did.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: They want more money. They are trying to make two days out of it?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: No, no they know another track - to the side of this.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Those 80 acres, that cross the stream, what do you think of them?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: On your property?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Yes

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Good, flatish land with reliable water, why? I don't have money. What are you about?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I'd like to make a swap.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: The piano.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: The piano on the beach? Ada's piano?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: You'd have to organise it up here.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Yes, I thought that.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Well Baines the music lover, I never would have known. Hidden talents George.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I'll have to get lessons. It wouldn't be much use without them.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Yes, I suppose you would.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: T-w~e-l-v~e.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Te, kawnarna paraikete mo te tahi hawlie 0 te whenna uci.  UNSUBTITLED

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Yes, why not.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Ada says you're doing well with the piano?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: I'll have to come and hear you play. what do you play.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Nothing just yet

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: I don't think you should have given up the piano. I will make sure you are properly taught, with music written on to sheets and...

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I don't want to learn.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: You don't want to learn.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: And what does this do to our bargain? I cannot afford the piano if you mean me to pay.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: No, no payment. I have given it back. I don't want it.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Well, I doubt I want it very much myself.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: It was more to your wife that I gave it.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Well, thank you, I expect she will appreciate it.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Has Ada ever spoken to you?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: You mean in signs?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: No, words. You have never heard words?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: No, not words.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: She has spoken to me. I heard her voice. There was no sound, but I beard it here . Her voice was there in my head. I watched her lips, they did not make the words, yet the harder I listened the clearer I heard her, as clear as I hear you, as dear as I hear my own voice.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Spoken words?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: No, but her words are in my head.  I know what you think, that it's a trick, that I'm making it up. No, the words I heard, were her words.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Please take us to the beach where we landed.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I'm sorry, I can't do that.  I don't have the time.  Goodbye

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: You have to wash them.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: They are washed.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Wash them again.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: The marks do not come out. They are scars and hardened skin.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: She wants to see what you can do.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I'd rather not play. I want to listen and learn that way.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Everyone has to practice.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I just want to listen.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: He says you're not to see her or he'll chop her up!

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Quiet down! Shhh! Where is she?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: He chopped it off

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: Jesus! I'll kill him! I'll kill him. What did she tell him?

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: What did she say?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: She says, throw the piano overboard.

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: It's quite safe, they are managing...

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: She says, throw it overboard. She doesn't want it. She says it's spoiled

turns.speaker: BAINES
turns.text: I have the key here, look, I'll have it mended...

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: What's in here then, lead?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: It's my mother's piano.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: A piano?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Oh no, it can't come now.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: It must come.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: She wants it to come.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Yes and so do I, but there are too few of us here to carry it. TOO - HEAVY

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: We can't leave the piano

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Let us not discuss this further. I am very pleased....

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Hello, then.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: What on?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: On your piano, that is the swap.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: What does she say?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: She says it's her piano, and she won't have him touch it. He's an oaf, he can't read, he's ignorant.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: He wants to improve himself... and you will be able to play on it ...  Teach him to look after it.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: I know why Mr. Baines can't play the piano.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: You've missed this bit.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: She never gives him a turn.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: And when is the next lesson?

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: He's given it to us.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Hah, you're very cunning Ada, but I've seen through you, I'm not going to lose the land this way. Wait here!

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Is it all right? Aren't you going to play something? ADA pulls up a chair and seats herself at the piano. She rubs her hands and places them lightly on the keys, she turns from habit over her left shoulder where STEWART waits crossed armed. Quickly she removes her hands, stands and gestures FLORA to play. FLORA proudly takes ~p the seat, she pulls her lips in trying to control her happiness to say in front of both her mother and STEWART.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: What will I play?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Play a gig.

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Do I know any gigs?

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Play a song then

turns.speaker: FLORA
turns.text: Mama.

turns.speaker: STEWART
turns.text: Take this to Baines. Tell him if he ever tries to see her again I'll take off another and another and another!

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: You the owner here?

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Lieutenant Snyder.  Bunco.

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: Joliet badge, Snyder.  Don't cut much up here.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: I'm lookin' for a guy on the lam from a counterfeiting rap.  Thought he mighta come in here.

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: Don't think so.  I know everybody in the place and I always bounce the lamsters.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: All right if I look around your lobby?

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: No, but you're welcome to a free beer before you go.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Which way are the rooms?

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: Who told ya this guy was in here?

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Nobody.  I just know what kinda women he likes.  I'm gonna check all the joyhouses till I find him.

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: Maybe I could help ya if ya told me his name.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: I think I'll keep that to myself. Which way are the rooms?

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: Right through there.  But I wouldn't go in there if I were you.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: What are ya gonna do, call the cops?

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: I don't have to.  You'll be bustin' in on the Chief of Police just up the hall.

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: Visitation is still up by two at the three-quarters.  Single Action second, Fasanella third.

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: What's the line on Visitation?

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: 7 to 2.  That ain't bad.

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: He'll probably fall down.

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: Best we had was Cat's Eye in the second at Del Mar, and he was only 5-2.  Not many longshots comin' in today.

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: Billie.  You ready?

turns.speaker: BILLIE
turns.text: Yeh, go ahead.

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: At the finish, it's Single Action by two, Fasanella second, Visitation third.  Line on Single Action... 3 to 2. Hell with it, that's no good.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: The wallet.  You gotta go after him. He's got all the money.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: Don't worry, we got the wallet. What happened?  He get ya with the knife?

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Give it to me!  Please.  I gotta know it's all there!

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: You just sit tight, old man.  We're gonna have to get you to a doctor.  I'll call a cop.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: No, no cops!

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: You wanted by the law or somethin'?

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Naw, it's okay.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: You're crazy carryin' that kinda money in this neighborhood.  No wonder you got hit.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Thanks.  I'm obliged to ya, but I gotta get goin'.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: You ain't goin' nowhere on that leg.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: I gotta!  Look, I run some slots down in West Bend for a mob here. I got a little behind on my payoffs so they figure I been holdin' out on 'em.  They gave me to 4:00 to come up with the cash.  I don't get it there I'm dead.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: It don't look good, gramps, it's ten of now.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: I got a hundred bucks for you and your friend if you deliver the money for me.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: I dunno.  That little mug that got ya is mad enough at me already -- what if he's out there waitin' around a corner with some friends.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: He won't know you're carryin' it. C'mon, you gotta help me out.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: Sorry, pal.  I'll fix you up, call you a doc, but I ain't gonna walk into a bunch of knives for ya.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: How bout you?  I'll give you the whole hundred!

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: What makes you think you can trust him?  He didn't do shit.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: If that punk and his pals decide to search ya, you'll never fool 'em carryin' it there.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: You got a bag or somethin?

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: How 'bout a handkerchief?

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: BLACK MAN
turns.text: Jesus, what a bundle.  Did you know he was that loaded?

turns.speaker: STRANGER
turns.text: Hell no, I just cut into him.  I woulda settled for pawning one of them shoes.

turns.speaker: BOUDREAU
turns.text: Twist!  When did you get back in town?

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Coupla days ago.  I'm workin' a big one with Gondorff on the North Side.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Listen Duke, we're setting up a wire store.  I need a twenty man boost right away.

turns.speaker: BOUDREAU
turns.text: I got twenty or so in here tonight. Take your pick.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: These guys have gotta be the quill, Duky.  We can't afford to rank the joint.

turns.speaker: BOUDREAU
turns.text: Get me the sheet, Jake.  Let's see who's in town.

turns.speaker: BOUDREAU
turns.text: Twist, you know this guy?

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: No.  Never saw him before.  He's a dick, though.

turns.speaker: BOUDREAU
turns.text: Paltrow, Sterling, Furey, and the Big Alabama are in from New Orleans. Fiskin and the Boone Kid from Denver, and Phillips, Barnett and Limehouse Chappie from New York. Those and the guys outside should give ya 30 or so to choose from.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Good, have 'em down at Stenner's old Pool Hall before 3:00.  We're gonna run through the route tonight.

turns.speaker: BOUDREAU
turns.text: Okay, Twist, but you know if this blows up, I can't do ya no good downtown.  Gondorff is Federal.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Don't worry about it, pal.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: You're late.  Where you been?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I had some appointments.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: How much did ya lose?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: All of it.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: In one goddamn night?  What are ya sprayin' money around like that for? You coulda been nailed.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I checked the place out.  There weren't no dicks in there.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: You're a con man, and you blew it like a pimp.  I didn't teach ya to be no pimp.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What's eatin' you?  I've blown money before.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: No class grifter woulda' done it, that's all.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You think my play is bad?

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: I think it's the best...

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: ...It's the only reason I ain't quit before now.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: I'm gettin' too slow for this racket.  I done the best I'm gonna do.  You hang on too long, you start embarrassin' yourself.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?  We just took off the biggest score we've ever had.  We can do anything we want now.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: It's nothin' compared to what you could be makin' on the Big Con. You're wastin' your time workin' street marks.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Hey look.  You think I'm gonna run out on ya or somethin'?  Just cause we hit it big.  Luther, I owe you everything.  If you hadn't taught me con, I wouldn't know nothin'.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: Aw hell, you sound like some goddamn sucker.  You know everything I know.  You got nothin' more to learn from me.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: But you played the Big Con.  You said it was nothin'.  A game for flakes and mama's boys.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: And I'm tellin' ya now, you're a fool if you don't get into it.  A bigger fool than I was.  I been lookin' for this one all my life, Johnny.  Now I got a chance to step out at the top.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What the hell you gonna do with yourself?

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: Aw, I got a brother down in K.C., runs a freight outlet.  I can go halfsies with 'em!  It ain't too exciting, but it's mostly legal.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: Straighten up, kid.  I wouldn't turn ya out if ya weren't ready.  I got a guy named Henry Gondorff I want you to look up.  There ain't a better insideman alive.  He'll teach ya everything ya gotta know.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You'll take a cut of what I make, won't ya?

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: I'm out, Johnny.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: If that's the way you want it.

turns.speaker: COLEMAN
turns.text: That's the way I want it.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: We'll put Salino on it.  I need somebody careful.

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: Salino?  Why waste our best people on a small-time job like this?  It ain't no heavy gee we're after. The guy's a five and dime grifter.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Then why ain't he dead?

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: They didn't think he'd be so cagey, that's all.  They'll get him next time.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Use Salino.  It'll take a little longer, but there won't be any holes in it.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: And tell Cole I wanta see him when he gets in.

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: He's not comin' in.  Not to get bounced off a job anyway.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: He had his chance and all he did was shoot up a rooming house.  Made a lotte noise and woke up a few cops, but didn't hit nothin'.

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: Granger, this is Combs.  Why haven't we heard from ya?  Everybody else is in.

turns.speaker: GRANGER
turns.text: We had a few problems with the Law this morning.  The Mayor promised the Jaycees to get tough on the rackets again, so he shut everybody down for a couple hours to make it look good.  Nothing serious, it just put us a little behind for the day.

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: You been making your payoffs, haven't ya?

turns.speaker: GRANGER
turns.text: Hell yes.  He does this every year. There's nothing to worry about.

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: Okay, finish your count and get it up here as soon as you can.  I don't wanta be here all night.

turns.speaker: GRANGER
turns.text: Believe me, the Man's gonna be real happy.  Looks like we cleared over ten grand this week.

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: We cleared 22 here.

turns.speaker: GRANGER
turns.text: Well, hell, you got the whole Chicago south side.  How do ya expect the eight lousy spots I've got to compete with that?

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: They did 14 grand in Evanston, 16.5 is Gary, and 20 in Cicero.  Looks like you're bringing up the rear, Granger.

turns.speaker: GRANGER
turns.text: I just got the count.  We'll put the take on the 4:15.

turns.speaker: COMBS
turns.text: We'll be waitin'.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Buck Duff.  I was in Maxwell's boost in Troy.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: You the Duff that didn't come up with his end when Little Jeff was sent up?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Wasn't no problem a mine.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: He was a con man, wasn't he?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: He was a tear-off rat.  He got what he deserved.  No sense helpin' pay his bills.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Shove off, Duff.

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: Hey, Luther told me he was carrying a wad, but I didn't figure this much.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Which way did he do, Eirie?

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: Straight north.  He was gonna take it all and run.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: The bastard.  He can blow his nose all the way.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: How do you like that Coleman, huh? After three years.

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: Aw come on, it was the only thing to do.  He knew he was holdin' ya back.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: We were partners.  If it weren't for Luther I'd still be hustlin' pinball down at Gianelli's.  I don't need anything more than I got.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You ain't gonna have nothin' if you don't lay off them games of chance. There's a depression on ya know.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: There's always a depression on.

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: If you saved a little, you wouldn't have to grift so much.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I like griftin'.

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: You could buy yourself some things. Clothes, or a nice car...

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I don't look any good in clothes and I don't know how to drive. What else ya got to sell, Eirie?

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: I thought you blew all your money.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I did.  That stuff I gave him was counterfeit.  They'll pinch him the first place he tries to spend it.

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: What the hell you gonna do when Snyder rushes his finger right to Lonnegan?  You're committin' suicide, kid.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Aw Christ, it doesn't make no difference now.  If Snyder knows about it so does everybody else. He never gets anything first...Damn, there's no answer at Luther's.

turns.speaker: EIRIE KID
turns.text: Listen to me, Hooker.  What ever you do, don't go back to your place tonight, don't go anyplace you usually go, ya hear me?  Get outa town or somethin', but...

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Doyle, can I see you a minute?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I'm busy, Floyd.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: It's important.  We had a little trouble in Chicago today.  One of our runners got hit for 12 grand.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Mottola.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You sure he didn't just pocket it?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: No, we checked his story with a tipster.  He was cleaned by two grifters on 47th.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: They workin' for anybody?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I don't know.  Could be.  We're runnin' that down now.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: All right, mark Mottola up a little and put him on a bus.  Nothin' fancy, just enough to keep him from coming back.  Get some local people to take care of the other two.  We gotta discourage this kinda thing.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: We got word from Chicago.  They got one of the grifters last night. The nigger.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: What about the other one?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: They're still looking for him.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Who's got the contract?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Combs gave it to Reilly and Cole.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Hackers.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: They staked out the other guy's place last night, but he never showed.  They figure maybe he skipped town.  You wanna follow 'em up?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Name's Danny McCoy.  No Neck McCoy we called him.  Runs a few protection rackets for Carnello while he's waiting for something bigger to come along.  Me and Danny been friends since we were six. Take a good look at that face, Floyd, cause if he ever finds out we let one lousy grifter beat us, you'll have to kill him and every other hood in Chicago who'd like to do the same thing.  You understand what I'm sayin'?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Good lad.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I've had it with that bum, Floyd. Stack me a cooler.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: You've only been playin three hours, Doyle.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I don't care.  Load me a deck.  Set it up for threes and nines.  I'll cut it in on his deal.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: What do ya want the others to get?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Nothin'.  They gotta be outa there early.  I'm gonna bust that bastard in one play.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I know I give him four threes.  We can't let him get away with that.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: What am I supposed to do?  Call him for cheating better than me?

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: Looks all right.  It's big enough and off the street.

turns.speaker: GARFIELD
turns.text: I don't know.  This is kinda short notice.  I'm not sure we can get it all done by Saturday.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: Got to.  Gondorff's ridin' the mark in from New York on the Century.

turns.speaker: GARFIELD
turns.text: Been a while since I stocked a wire store.  Not many mobs playing that anymore.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: All we need is the bookie setup for now.  We'll worry about the telegraph office later.

turns.speaker: GARFIELD
turns.text: All right, I'll rent ya everything I got in the warehouse for two grand.  That'll give ya phones, cages, blackboards and ticker gear. You supply the guys to move 'em. If you want a counter and bar, that's another grand.  I don't know where the hell I'm gonna get 'em though.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: C'mon, you can do better than that. We ain't no heel grifters.

turns.speaker: GARFIELD
turns.text: You want the stuff tomorrow or don't ya?  It's gonna take hours just to clean it up.  Besides, Gondorff's still a hot item.  Where am I gonna be if he gets hit?

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: Just give us what ya can, Benny. We'll send a truck down.

turns.speaker: GARFIELD
turns.text: We bought ya a tap into Moe Anenberg's wire.  He's got eyes at every track in the country.  You'll get race results, odds, scratches, pole positions, everything; and just as fast as Western Union gets 'em.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: Does J.J. know how to use this thing?

turns.speaker: GARFIELD
turns.text: All he's gotta do is read.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Turn the goddamn thing off, will ya.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You sober?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: I can talk, can't I?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Glad to meet ya, kid.  You're a real horse's ass.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Yeh, Luther said you could teach me something.  I already know how to drink.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: I'm sorry about Luther.  He was the best street worker I ever saw.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He had you down as a big-timer. What happened?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Aw, I conned a Senator from Florida on a stocks deal.  A real lop-ear. He thought he was gonna take over General Electric.  Some Chantoozie woke him up, though, and he put the feds on me.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You mean you blew it.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Luther didn't tell me you had a big mouth.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He didn't tell me you was a fuck- up, either.  You played the Big Con since then.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: No, I lammed it around for a while while things cooled off.  Philly, Denver, Baltimore, nuthin' towns.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You gonna stay for breakfast, or do you already know how to eat?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I picked something up on the way.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Lonnegan after you, too?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I don't know.  Haven't seen anybody.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You never do, kid.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Gondorff, you gonna teach me the Big Con or not?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You didn't act much like you wanted to learn it.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I wanna play for Lonnegan.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You know anything about him?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Yeh, he croaked Luther.  What else do I gotta know.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Aw right, he runs the numbers outta the south side.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: And a packing company, a chain of Savings and Loans and half the politicians in Chicago and New York. There ain't a fix in the world gonna cool him out if he blows on ya.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I'll take him anyway.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: 'Cause I don't know enough about killin' to kill him.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You can't do it alone, ya know.  It takes a mob of guys like you and enough money to make 'em look good.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: We'll get by without 'em.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: This isn't like playin' winos on the street.  You gotta do more than outrun the guy.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I never played for winos.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You gotta keep Lonnegan's con, even after you spent his money.  And no matter how much you take from his, he'll get more.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You're sacred of 'em, aren't ya?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Right down to my socks, turkey.  If I'da been half as scared a that lop-ear, I wouldn't a fallen asleep on 'em.  Lonnegan might kill me, but at least he won't bore me to death.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Then you'll do it?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: If I can find a mob that'll risk it. But no matter what happens, I don't want you comin' back to me halfway through and sayin' it's not enough... cause it's all you got.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He's not as tough as he'd like to think.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Neither are we.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He's waitin' for you in the card room.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Let him wait.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You just worry about your end, kid.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: If we ever get to it.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: How'd ya do?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Well we got some workin' money anyway.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Everything go all right?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Yeh, it was easy.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: No signs of trouble?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What do ya mean?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You know, somebody tailin' ya.  A torpedo or somethin'.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: No, not a thing.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: How 'bout Lonnegan?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I gave him the breakdown just like ya told me to.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He threatened to kill me.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Hell, they don't do that and you know you're not gettin' through to 'em.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Then he drove me home.  He tried to put himself away as legit, so I went right into the pitch.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Did he hold you up on anything?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You think he'll show?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Did he say he wouldn't?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: He'll show.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me about Snyder before?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I thought I'd lost him.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Well you found him again and we're gonna have to do somethin' about it. What else haven't ya been tellin' me?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Nothin'.  I told ya everything there is.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Then why'd ya move outa your room?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: It was too noisy.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You can't play your friends like marks, Hooker.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You know how easy it'd be for one of Lonnegan's guys to nail you?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: All we need is a couple days, Henry. A couple days and we'll get Lonnegan down and stomp on 'em.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You just won't learn, will ya. Hell, you come in here, I teach you stuff maybe five guys in this world know, stuff most grifters couldn't do even if they knew it, and all you wanna do is run down a bullet.  You're just like all them new jerks. Lotsa nerve and no brains.  And ten years from now when me and the others are through and you dumb guys are all dead there won't be one gee left who knows the Big Con was anything more than a way to make a livin'.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: A couple days; that's all I'm askin'.  I can stay clear that long.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Christ, they'll probably miss you and hit me.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: What's the matter, kid?  You're not sayin' much.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Just a little nervous, that's all.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Luther always told me to bite my toenails when I get nervous.  You see yourself doin' that and you realize it ain't worth it.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Take it easy, you won't lose him now.  We had him 10 years ago when he decided to be somebody.  Believe me, I've seen enough to know.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: How many guys you conned in your life, Henry?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Two or three hundred I guess. Sometimes played two a day when I was in Shea's mob.  We had it down to a business.  'Course Chicago was a right town then.  The fix was in.  The dicks took their end without a beef.  All the Wall Street boys wanted to make investments for us.  Even had marks looking us up, thinkin' they could beat the game.  Yeh, kid, it really stunk.  No sense in bein' a grifter if it's the same as bein' a citizen.
